chargeHist.descr: Violation of Temporary Restraining Order - Harassment

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Violation of Temporary Restraining Order - Harassment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vang N. Xiong

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(2:57 PM case called.) Defendant Vang N. Xiong in court. Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Vang N. Xiong. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Interpreter Zongcheng Moua sworn and interprets.
Attorney Cook advises there is no agreement and requests a new status conference.
State advises needs a couple weeks to be able to get in contact with the victim.
Status Conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 11 am (1/2 hour) in person.
(End: 3:00 PM.)
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Case called at 9:31 AM. Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Vang N. Xiong appeared by video, in custody from the jail.  Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Vang N. Xiong.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Hmong Interpreter Zongcheng Moua appeared via video. He is sworn and interprets. Defendant waives his right to personal appearance but requests to appear in person at the next hearing.
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas.  Attorney Cook requests the matter be set for STC in 45 days.
STC: 10/27/22 at 3:00 PM (in person).
Adjourned at 9:38 AM.
Arraignment on September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Same as Complaint.

(3:11 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vang N. Xiong in court, in custody. Clayton Cavanaugh Law Intern, supervised by Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Vang N. Xiong.
Interpreter Vann (#254088), sworn and interprets.
State advises is ready to proceed. Attorney Cook requests an adjournment of one week given the communication issues and advises the defendant would like an interpreter from the State Public Defender Office in person with him.
Court denies the request as the interpreter advises he is a certified interpreter.
State calls Officer Matthew Sanda of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Cook and Intern Cavanaugh conduct cross-examination of Officer Sanda. 
State conducts re-direct of Officer Sanda. 
Attorney Cook and Intern Cavanaugh conduct re-cross-examination of Officer Sanda. Witness excused.
State moves for bind over. Attorney Cook and Intern Cavanaugh argues against bind over.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Cook to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.
(End: 03:53 PM)

10:37am Defendant Vang N. Xiong appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Vang N. Xiong.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Donna Minter, from Wisconsin Forensic Unit appears via Zoom video. Interpreter Tou Ja-Vue Yang did not appear. Parties have received and reviewed a copy of the doctor's report. Parties agree with Dr. Minter's findings. Defendant agrees that he is competent. Defense requests a preliminary hearing in this matter.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

*CONFIDENTIAL*
by Dr. Donna Minter, dated 06/07/2022
Competency hearing on July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

(3:00 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vang N. Xiong in court, in custody. Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Vang N. Xiong.
Interpreter Kazoua Yang does not appear.
Court notes the Examiner is unable to complete the exam and file the report until July 5, 2022.
Parties schedule a new date for Competency Hearing.
Competency Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am (1/2 hour) via Zoom.
Dated 05/13/2022, Letter from Dr. Donna Minter to Court requesting an extension for competency evaluation.

Conditions: 
No contact with L.E. or L.E.'s residence.
Comply with pre-trial monitoring services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

Conditions: 
No contact with L.E. or L.E.'s residence.
Comply with pre-trial monitoring services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
Competency hearing on June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(10:30 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vang N. Xiong in court, in custody. Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Vang N. Xiong.
Interpreter Kazoua Yang sworn and interprets.
Court notes the defendant didn't appear for the competency evaluation so the Court ordered a $10,000.00 cash bond.
Court notes at the last hearing the Court ordered another order for competency examination to be conducted.
Court allows argument for bond modification.
Attorney Cook advises the defendant is willing to cooperate and complete the competency examination and also advises the defendant is pending revocation.
Court orders the $10,000.00 signature bond is reinstated with the following conditions: No contact with L.E. or L.E.'s residence and to comply with pre-trial monitoring services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
Competency Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 3 pm (1/2 hour) in person.
(End: 10:42 AM)

2:00 PM  case called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Vang N. Xiong appeared by video, in custody. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
State asks court to find Good Cause to extend the time limits for completing the competency hearing. Defendant advises he would like an interpreter at future court hearings. 
Court sets a $10,000 cash bond with previous conditions to apply. 
A competency hearing is scheduled for 5/5/22 at 10:30 AM (30 min, in person).
Dated 04/21/2022, Letter from Dr. Donna Minter to Court regarding no contact with defendant for competency evaluation.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

Competency hearing on April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions:

(11:08 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vang N. Xiong appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Vang N. Xiong.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
State raises competency. Court reviews the complaint and finds probable cause. Court advises the scheduled preliminary hearing will not be held at the time previously set as a competency hearing will now be held.
Court orders competency examination to be completed.

Conditions:
No contact with L.E. or L.E.'s residence.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
